# Anthropic updates to hide Claude’s AI actions, devs hate it

[Tim Anderson Tim Anderson](https://www.devclass.com/author/tim-anderson)

Published mon 16 Feb 2026 // 13:02 UTC

https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.devclass.com%2Fdevelopment%2F2026%2F02%2F16%2Fclaude-code-gets-more-opaque-devs-want-more-transparency%2F4091233 https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.devclass.com%2Fdevelopment%2F2026%2F02%2F16%2Fclaude-code-gets-more-opaque-devs-want-more-transparency%2F4091233 https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.devclass.com%2Fdevelopment%2F2026%2F02%2F16%2Fclaude-code-gets-more-opaque-devs-want-more-transparency%2F4091233 https://bsky.app/intent/compose?text=Claude%20code%20gets%20more%20opaque%2C%20devs%20want%20more%20transparency%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.devclass.com%2Fdevelopment%2F2026%2F02%2F16%2Fclaude-code-gets-more-opaque-devs-want-more-transparency%2F4091233 https://www.reddit.com/submit?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.devclass.com%2Fdevelopment%2F2026%2F02%2F16%2Fclaude-code-gets-more-opaque-devs-want-more-transparency%2F4091233&title=Claude%20code%20gets%20more%20opaque%2C%20devs%20want%20more%20transparency https://api.whatsapp.com/send?text=Claude%20code%20gets%20more%20opaque%2C%20devs%20want%20more%20transparency%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.devclass.com%2Fdevelopment%2F2026%2F02%2F16%2Fclaude-code-gets-more-opaque-devs-want-more-transparency%2F4091233

Anthropic has updated Claude Code, its AI coding tool, changing the progress output to hide the names of files the tool was reading, writing or editing; but developers have pushed back stating that they need to see which files are accessed.

Version 2.1.20 collapsed the output so that instead of showing, for example, the file names and how many lines were read, it would just print "Read 3 files (ctrl+o to expand)," according to a [post](https://symmetrybreak.ing/blog/claude-code-is-being-dumbed-down/) complaining that "Claude Code is being dumbed down." The full details can still be accessed with the keyboard shortcut, but constantly invoking this is annoying and impractical.

DEVCLASS AD

A [GitHub issue](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code/issues/21151) on the subject drew a [response](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code/issues/21151#issuecomment-3812828803) from Boris Cherny, creator and head of Claude Code at Anthropic, that "this isn’t a vibe coding feature, it’s a way to simplify the UI so you can focus on what matters, diffs and bash/mcp outputs." He suggested that developers "try it out for a few days" and said that Anthropic, developers "appreciated the reduced noise."

Cherny said that developers who wanted more detail could enable verbose mode; but the response was, for example, that "verbose mode is not a viable alternative, there’s way too much noise."

Developers have many reasons for wanting to see the file names, such as for security, for knowing immediately if Claude is pulling context from the wrong files, and for easy audit of past activity by scrolling through conversation. "When I’m working on a complex codebase, knowing what context Claude is pulling helps me catch mistakes early and steer the conversation."

DEVCLASS AD

There is a financial impact, since if developers spot that Claude is going down a wrong track, they can interrupt and avoid wasting tokens.

Another observation was that output such as "searched for 2 patterns, read 3 files" conveys no useful information. "It’s not a nice simplification, it’s an idiotic removal of valuable information," [said](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code/issues/21151#issuecomment-3844716512) a user.

Cherny responded to the feedback by making changes. "We have repurposed the existing verbose mode setting for this," he [said](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code/issues/21151#issuecomment-3887552218), so that it "shows file paths for read/searches. Does not show full thinking, hook output, or subagent output (coming in tomorrow’s release)."

The problem with this is that making verbose mode less verbose is a bad change for those who wanted the full details.

DEVCLASS AD

Cherny also participated in a lengthy [discussion](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46978710) on Hacker News. "Claude has gotten more intelligent, it runs for longer periods of time, and it is able to more agentically use more tools … the amount of output this generates can quickly become overwhelming in a terminal, and is something we hear often from users," he said.

Those users who want the collapsed output seem to be mostly absent from the discussion. "I can’t tell you how many times I benefitted from seeing the files Claude was reading, to understand how I could interrupt and give it a little more context… saving thousands of tokens" [said](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46982115) one response.

Cherny said that the repurposed verbose mode was the solution, and that Claude Code will still default to the condensed view.

DEVCLASS AD

The debate is important, because if AI tools like Claude Code hide what they are doing from developers (or other users) then it is more likely that mistakes will go unnoticed. "I'm a Claude user who has been burned lately by how opaque the system has become," [said](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46988932) another developer. "Right now Claude cannot be trusted to get things right without constant oversight and frequent correction, often for just a single step. For people like me, this is make or break. If I cannot follow the reasoning, read the intent, or catch logic disconnects early, the session just burns through my token quota."

Claude Code changes frequently so it is likely that this aspect will be further tweaked, but there is not yet any indication that it will revert to the old behavior.
